Articles.Content:
Hi there!

I was thinking the other day about how the ISS orbits very close to the surface of the Earth, and how someone with even a poor telescope should be able to see it easily.

I remembered also that the ISS has had astronauts go on EVA numerous times, and began to wonder if anyone has taken a picture of an EVAing astronaut from the surface?

Has anyone ever encountered such a photo? And if not, does anyone know when the next EVA is planned?

Inideed I have

http://legault.perso.sfr.fr/STS-133.html

That guy has tons of awesome space photos.
Seeing that must be amazing... Naked eye is cool enough.

Hi there!

I was thinking the other day about how the ISS orbits very close to the surface of the Earth, and how someone with even a poor telescope should be able to see it easily.

I remembered also that the ISS has had astronauts go on EVA numerous times, and began to wonder if anyone has taken a picture of an EVAing astronaut from the surface?

Has anyone ever encountered such a photo? And if not, does anyone know when the next EVA is planned?

Close to the surface?

Sounds dangerous and a terrible plan...

I love it.
